abstract: Pres-elect Donald Trump picks Gen John F Kelly as his choice for secretary of Homeland Security; retired four-star Marine general's experience running United States Southern Command shaped his tough stances on border security and drugs, while death of his son in Afghanistan in 2010 has given him firsthand experience of costs of war.

byline.original: By MARK LANDLER and MAGGIE HABERMAN
byline.contributor: Mark Landler reported from Washington, and Maggie Haberman from New York. Charlie Savage contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: General Kelly had a 40-year career in the Marine Corps. In 2010, one of his sons was killed while leading a platoon in Afghanistan.

headline.main: Donald Trump Picks John Kelly, Retired General, to Lead Homeland Security
headline.print_headline: For Homeland Security, a Man Accustomed to Patrolling Borders
